marketNews.title: Foreign Inflow Rp2 T, IHSG Rebound +2.1%
marketNews.content: The IHSG strengthened by +2.11% to the level of 7,196.02 today, Tuesday (3/11), accompanied by a foreign inflow of 2.08 trillion rupiah. This is the first inflow - both for the regular market and overall - after consecutive outflows since November 6, 2024, which was the main factor causing the IHSG to dive -4.12% in the last 1 month. Looking at the nominal size, today's foreign inflow is the largest since September 19, 2024, when the inflow was also recorded at 2.08 trillion rupiah. Today's foreign inflow consisted of 797 billion rupiah in the regular market and 1.3 trillion rupiah in the cash and negotiation markets.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although it is still too early to conclude that foreign investors are re-entering Indonesia, the end of the daily outflow trend is at least a breath of fresh air for investors. Sectorally, sectors sensitive to interest rates - such as banking (IDXFINANCE +1.55%), property (IDXPROPERTY +1.12%), and technology (IDXTECHNO +3.18%) - experienced significant increases today.

marketNews.title: Government Policy Updates
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the government will start implementing biodiesel with a 50% palm oil blend or B50 starting in 2026, faster than the previous plan which targeted to start in 2028. Bahlil mentioned that the acceleration of B50 implementation is aimed at reducing diesel imports. Previously, the Ministry of Agriculture estimated that the application of B50 would require a supply of 20 million kiloliters of CPO per year, higher than B35 (13.4 million kiloliters per year) and B40 (16.08 million kiloliters per year). The government itself will start implementing B40 in January 2025. A senior researcher at the Institute for Economic and Social Research, Faculty of Economics and Business, University of Indonesia, Riyanto, estimated that car sales in 2025 will drop by -12% YoY to the level of 700,000-750,000 units if the government implements a Value Added Tax (VAT) of 12% and an excise tax surcharge starting January 2025. Meanwhile, the Vice President Director of PT Toyota Astra Motor, Henry Tanoto, stated that the increase in VAT and excise tax surcharge will affect vehicle selling prices and people's purchasing power, potentially pushing the domestic automotive market lower. The excise tax surcharge itself is an additional tax levy based on a certain percentage, where the district/city government will collect the surcharge from motor vehicle tax (PKB), motor vehicle name transfer tax (BBNKB), and non-metal and rock mineral tax (MBLB). On another note, a fiscal policy analyst at the Fiscal Policy Agency of the Ministry of Finance, Rustam Effendi, said that the excise tax surcharge for PKB and BBNKB does not need to be worried about because it will not add to the taxpayer's burden. The Director General of Customs and Excise of the Ministry of Finance, Askolani, stated that the government will announce an increase in the retail selling price (HJE) of tobacco products in the near future, although he did not provide further details. Responding to this discourse, the Chairman of the Indonesian Cigarette Manufacturers Association, Henry Najoan, mentioned that they hope the government will not increase the HJE or cigarette excise tax until 2027, considering the cigarette industry is still struggling to recover post-cigarette excise tax hikes in recent years. Henry mentioned that an increase in cigarette HJE amidst declining public purchasing power will make illegal cigarette products more widespread. The Deputy Minister of Industry, Faisol Reza, stated that the government plans to increase the minimum domestic content level (TKDN) requirement for smartphones sold in Indonesia. Faisol mentioned that the government is currently discussing this plan, so the new TKDN ratio or when the regulation will be implemented cannot yet be determined. This plan to increase TKDN comes amid Apple Inc.'s (Nasdaq: AAPL) efforts to sell the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia. In recent recent weeks, Apple has increased its investment offer in Indonesia from US$10 million to US$100 million to obtain a 40% TKDN certificate so that the iPhone 16 series can be sold in Indonesia, but the government rejected the proposal because it considered the amount still too small compared to Apple's investments in other countries. The Director of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, Irvan Susandy, stated that starting December 9, 2024, they will expand the list of stocks that can be traded in the pre-opening session. Later, stocks listed on the main board, new economy, and development boards can be traded in the pre-opening session. This provision will be effective from December 9, 2024. Currently, stocks that can be traded in the pre-opening session are only the constituent stocks of the LQ45 index.

marketNews.title: China and Japan Monetary Policy Signals
marketNews.content: The Governor of the People's Bank of China, Pan Gongsheng, reiterated that the central bank plans to release accommodative monetary policy to boost economic growth in 2025, although he did not provide further details. Monetary policy support will be crucial for the Chinese economy next year, especially amid the threat of increased import tariffs proposed by the US President-elect, Donald Trump. The imposition of high tariffs on Chinese imports will threaten the country's export prospects, which has been a driver of China's economic growth since the pandemic. Bloomberg reported that the Chinese economy has shown signs of stabilization in recent weeks, mainly after the central bank and the Chinese government released a stimulus package at the end of September 2024. The Governor of the Bank of Japan, Kazuo Ueda, signaled that the central bank will raise interest rates again at the meeting on December 19, 2024. If realized, this step will mark the first time Japanese interest rates have been raised 3 times in a calendar year since 1989. Ueda mentioned that the time to raise interest rates is near given that inflation remains persistent, companies plan to invest, and wages are rising.

tickerNews.title: DOID Injects AU$62 Million Capital into Copper Mining Entity
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur through its business entity, Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama Pte. Ltd., announced that it will participate in the issuance of new shares by DOID's copper mining business entity, 29Metals Ltd. (ASX: 29M). In this corporate action, 29Metals Ltd. will issue new shares worth 180 million Australian dollars, where Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama Pte. Ltd. will exercise all of its pro-rata rights of approximately 62.1 million Australian dollars at a price of $0.27 Australian dollars per share. This price is 37% lower than the share price of 29Metals Ltd. on the Australian exchange at $0.37 US dollars as of Tuesday (3/11). Following this transaction, the ownership of Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama Pte. Ltd. together with its affiliate, BUMA Australia Pty. Ltd., is estimated to reach 19.9% in 29Metals Ltd.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Collaborates with LINK to Develop ICT Solutions
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital through its subsidiary, PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem, announced a strategic cooperation with Link Net (LINK) to develop information and communication technology (ICT) solutions throughout Indonesia. In this cooperation, LINK will be responsible for the provision, management, and maintenance of network infrastructure, while PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem will be responsible for providing internet service access, internet bandwidth, marketing and customer maintenance, up to brand ownership. The CEO of WIFI, Yune Marketatmo, stated that this cooperation is part of WIFI's affordable internet initiative, which aims to reach more than 40 million homes across Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: MEDC's Subsidiaries to Operate Three Renewable Energy Projects Commercially in January 2025
tickerNews.content: Bisnis reported that Medco Energi Internasional through its subsidiary, PT Medco Power Indonesia, is ready to commercially operate 3 new and renewable energy (EBT) generation projects in January 2025. The three projects consist of the Ijen geothermal power plant (PLTP) with a capacity of 100 MW, a solar power plant (PLTS) in Bali with a capacity of 2x25 MWp, and the PT Energi Listrik Batam (ELB) project with a capacity of 39 MW. Electricity from these three projects will be purchased by PLN at a price of 8.58 US cents per kWh for the Ijen PLTP, 5.92 US cents per kWh for the West Bali PLTS, 5.59 US cents for the East Bali PLTS, while the electricity sale tariff from the ELB project is unknown. MEDC is also currently processing contract extensions for 2 oil and gas blocks in East Java - namely Madura Offshore and Sampang - where the existing contracts for both oil and gas blocks will expire in 2027.

tickerNews.title: BFIN to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024
tickerNews.content: BFI Finance Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 421.1 billion rupiah or 28 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is on December 11, 2024, with payment on December 19, 2024. Referring to BFIN's stock price at the close of the exchange on Tuesday (3/12), the indicative dividend yield is 3.1%.

tickerNews.title: ELSA plans Business Diversification in Chemical Commodities for Biodiesel in 2025
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Elnusa will diversify its business in 2025 in the chemical commodity sector for biodiesel through its subsidiary, PT Elnusa Petrofin. Through this subsidiary, ELSA will trade a chemical compound called sodium methylate oxide, which is used as a catalyst in the production of fatty acid methyl ester in biodiesel. This step is taken by ELSA to support the biodiesel program with a 40% CPO mix or B40 from the government.

tickerNews.title: NELY To Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: Pelayaran Nelly Dwi Putri will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 35.3 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is on December 10, 2024, with payment on December 27, 2024. Referring to NELY's stock price at the close of the exchange on Tuesday (3/12), the indicative dividend yield is 3.3%.

tickerNews.title: SICO Targets Revenue Growth +12% YoY in 2025
tickerNews.content: The Director of Sigma Energy Compressindo, Prayoga Wisudharma, stated that the company targets revenue growth of +12% YoY in 2025, with an EBITDA target rising +7% YoY. To achieve this target, SICO will boost the utilization rate of its compressor fleet from 69% to 83%, increase operational efficiency through mini gas compressors powered by electric motors, and explore business opportunities for renting mini gas compressors to gas stations (SPBU).

tickerNews.title: Palma Serasih Increases Stake in PSGO
tickerNews.content: The controller of Palma Serasih, PT Jalinankasih Sesama, purchased 286.6 million shares of PSGO at an average price of 165 rupiah per share on December 2, 2024. The total transaction value reached 47.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Jalinankasih Sesama in PSGO increased from 43.501% to 45.021%.

tickerNews.title: CSIS Plans Rights Issue Up to ~3.9 Billion Shares with Up to 75% Dilution
tickerNews.content: Cahayasakti Investindo Sukses plans to hold a rights issue of up to ~3.9 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 75%. The ratio and exercise price have not been announced, while the proceeds obtained are intended for capital expenditure, working capital, and business growth and/or development. This rights issue will also be accompanied by the issuance of up to 392.1 million warrants. This plan will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on January 9, 2025.
